pageContext.description: The edges of the blade of slightly ogival outline; low-ridged midrib running the whole length of the blade; a hollow fluted grove runs parallel with and close to the cutting edge, behind this is a rounded ridge with V-shaped hollow beyond, defining outer edge of midrib.  Down each side of midrib are three cast or engraved parallel lines, and across bases of midrib three rows of engraved chevron ornament and one row of crossed zigzags; three large rivets at base of blade., Beautiful preservation and finish.
pageContext.other: 2-part, hand-drawn illustration with some dimensions., At least 3 different handwritings and inks/pencil on card.  All 3 appear in site information.
pageContext.publications: Bowman, W. (ed.) 1855,  Reliquaiae Antiquae Eboracenses, pp 39-40
pageContext.collection: Museum of the Leeds Philosophical  & Literary Society.,  Presented by W. H. Bartholomew Esq. C.E., Headingby.
pageContext.site: England, Yorkshire, Wakefield (near), Woodnook., Found while excavating a lock at a depth of 24 feet., 1842, Found in gravel bed above shale and below thick alluvial deposits
pageContext.museumCollection: Museum of Leeds Philosophical and Literary Society
